commitResults.messageTitle: Add Greet and Exit function + Renamed Chatbot
Add Add task and list function
Add Task, Action classes with function to mark tasks as done
Add ToDo, Event, Deadline classes to differentiate task types
Removed emoticons temporarily due to conflict with test scripts
Add GeneralException and error handling for incorrect user input
Fixed bug with delete function + Updated test script for I/O
Add LocalDate compatibility for Deadline tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Deadline object takes in a String to be set as its deadline.

LocalDate is more sensible because users can read the deadline in a
clear format. Deadline cannot just be any String and will reflect a
proper date.

Let's,
* Change the Deadline object to use LocalDate for deadline
* Update remaining code to accomodate the change

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor closely related code as classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Source code contains code handling many different aspects in the same
files.

Separating code into their respective aspects is more readable
and allows for tidy code.

Let's,
* Abstract all the code into 4 main classes: Ui, Storage, Parser and
  TaskList

commitResults.messageTitle: All files are in the same directory of main
commitResults.messageBody:
Separating related class files into their own packages increases
ease of reading and understanding the code and their function

Let's,
 * Package related class files together

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix issue with running 'run' using Gradle
Add JUnit tests for Task, ToDo, Event and Deadline
commitResults.messageBody:
Ensure classes are free of bugs

Multiple tests to check to correctness of the various methods in each
class so that the code can run smoothly without errors

commitResults.messageTitle: Package App as a JAR file
commitResults.messageBody:
Note: Running the JAR file creates a separate data folder under
ip/build/lib where it is located. This data folder is different from the
data folder that stores information when the code is run locally.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code to follow given coding standard
commitResults.messageBody:
Following a common coding standard allows for readability and ease of
understanding code across everyone who may access the source code
JavaDoc allows for ease of understanding code.

Allows users to filter for tasks with certain keywords.

Let's,
 * Update Parser to include "find" as a command.
 * Update TaskList to include "find" functionality.

Chatbot uses a Command-Line Interface.

A GUI is more pleasing to the eyes and user-friendly as users can
experience a more realistic chatting experience rather than through the
command line.

Let's, configure the necessary fxml files and update existing code to
fit a transtition to a GUI chatbot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assertions to various code sections.
commitResults.messageBody:
Assertions exist as an indicator for logically impossible situations
that may arise when running the code. It verifies the assumptions made
about the whole source code.

Let's,
 * Add assertion statements to Task and subclass constructors.
 * Add assertion statements to Storage switch statement default clause.
Add assertions to various code sections.

Tasks contain just their general description and duration or deadline if
applicable.

Adding tags provide additional information for each task.

Let's,
 * Add an array that allows for maximum of 3 tags per task.
 * Update TaskList and Parser to accomodate tagging and untagging tasks.
 * Update Storage to allow saving and loading of tasks and their tags.

Code is untidy and lacking in quality in some places.

Using comments from peer PR reviews as well as examining it personally,
refactoring the code makes it more readable,efficient, clean and prevents
possibilities of future bugs.

Let's,
 * Review the comments from peer reviews.
 * Ensure all code complies with Java coding standard.
 * Add new Javadoc and update existing ones.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix formatting issues regarding Task details
commitResults.messageBody:
The formatting for information regarding Deadline and Event objects
specifically is not consistent and included unnecessary leading and
trailing whitespaces.

Let's,
 * Use the trim command to remove such whitespaces when parsing the user
   input command.
 * Update Junit tests to accomodate the new changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug with storing tagged Tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Tagged tasks and untagged task cannot be saved/loaded into data savefile
due to indexing errors in the relevant Storage methods. Introducing a
new boolean indicating if a Task has tags can help with converting the
Task details into a properly formatted savestring.

Let's,
 * Add a new hasTags boolean in Tasks.
 * Edit Storage load and parse data methods.
 * Update Junit tests.

commitResults.messageTitle: Ensure code compliance with checkstyle guidelines
commitResults.messageBody:
Code is unable to pass Continuous Integration automated build checks due
to violations of checkstyle requirements.

Let's,
 * Rectify all checkstyle violations.
